project.name: Transparency for Patients at Home
project.description: Building Trust Between Patients, Families, and Hospitals

epics.title: Backend Integration and Architecture
epics.description: Implement backend service using Kotlin with Spring Boot, containerized with Docker

epics.title: Hospital-Side Functionality
epics.description: Extend functionality to support hospital staff including scheduling and appointment management

epics.title: UI/UX Improvements
epics.description: Improve usability and user experience for patients and families

backlog.title: Project Setup and Configuration
backlog.description: As a developer, I want the backend project initialized with proper structure so that we have a foundation to build upon

tasks.title: Initialize Kotlin + Spring Boot project with Gradle
Set up project package structure (controllers, services, models, repositories)
Configure application.yml for dev and prod environments

backlog.title: User Authentication System
backlog.description: As a user, I want to register and login securely so that my data is protected
acceptance_criteria: Users can register with email, password, and role
Users can login and receive JWT token
Passwords are encrypted using BCrypt
JWT tokens expire after 24 hours

tasks.title: Implement User entity with roles (Patient, Family, Doctor, Nurse)
Create JWT utility for token generation and validation

backlog.title: Role-Based Access Control
backlog.description: As an admin, I want different users to have different permissions so that data access is properly restricted
acceptance_criteria: Patients can only view their own data
Family members can view linked patient data
Hospital staff can access and manage patient records
Only staff can create appointments and care tasks

tasks.title: Configure Spring Security with role-based rules

backlog.title: Appointment Management API
backlog.description: As a user, I want to view and manage appointments through the API so that I can track my healthcare schedule
acceptance_criteria: API supports CRUD operations for appointments
Appointments have status tracking (scheduled, confirmed, completed, cancelled)
Appointments can be filtered by date range
Staff can create appointments for patients

tasks.title: Create Appointment entity with all required fields
Implement REST endpoints for appointment management

backlog.title: Care Task Management API
backlog.description: As a patient, I want to view and complete daily care tasks so that I can track my health routine
acceptance_criteria: Tasks can be created by hospital staff
Patients can view their assigned tasks
Patients can mark tasks as complete
Tasks support different frequencies (once, daily, weekly)

tasks.title: Implement REST endpoints for task management

backlog.title: Database Migration to PostgreSQL
backlog.description: As a developer, I want to use PostgreSQL in production so that data is persisted reliably

tasks.title: Set up PostgreSQL configuration for production

backlog.title: Visit Summary API
backlog.description: As a patient, I want to view summaries of my home care visits so that I can track my care history
acceptance_criteria: Visit summaries are linked to appointments
Summaries include notes, recommendations, and medications
Patients can view their visit history
Staff can create and edit summaries

backlog.title: Hospital Staff Account Management
backlog.description: As an admin, I want to create and manage hospital staff accounts so that doctors and nurses can access the system
acceptance_criteria: Admin can create doctor and nurse accounts
Staff profiles include specialization and department
Staff can update their availability
Admin can deactivate staff accounts

tasks.title: Extend User entity with staff-specific fields
Create StaffProfile entity for additional info
Create admin endpoints for staff management

backlog.title: Staff Availability Management
backlog.description: As a hospital staff member, I want to set my availability so that appointments can be scheduled appropriately
acceptance_criteria: Staff can set weekly availability schedule
Staff can mark time-off periods
System prevents scheduling during unavailable times
Availability is visible to scheduling system

backlog.title: Appointment Scheduling Workflow
backlog.description: As hospital staff, I want to schedule home visits efficiently so that patients receive timely care
acceptance_criteria: Staff can view available time slots
System suggests optimal scheduling based on location and availability
Appointments can be assigned to specific staff members
Conflicts are detected and prevented

tasks.title: Create scheduling algorithm for optimal slot selection

backlog.title: Appointment Rescheduling Requests
backlog.description: As a patient or family member, I want to request appointment changes so that I can manage my schedule
acceptance_criteria: Patients can request to reschedule appointments
Requests include preferred alternative times
Staff receives notifications of requests
Staff can approve or suggest alternatives

backlog.title: Emergency Case Handling
backlog.description: As hospital staff, I want to handle emergency cases so that urgent patient needs are addressed
acceptance_criteria: Staff can create emergency appointments
Emergency cases can override regular scheduling
Affected patients are notified of changes
Emergency cases are flagged in the system

tasks.title: Add emergency case dashboard for staff

backlog.title: Staff Dashboard
backlog.description: As hospital staff, I want a dashboard view so that I can see my daily schedule and tasks
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard shows today's appointments
Pending tasks and requests are visible
Quick actions for common operations
Patient summary accessible from dashboard

backlog.title: Patient-Family Linking
backlog.description: As a family member, I want to be linked to my patient so that I can view their care information
acceptance_criteria: Family members can request to link with a patient
Patients can approve family member access
Linked family members can view appointments and tasks
Access can be revoked at any time

tasks.title: Add permission checking for family access

backlog.title: User Flow Evaluation and Refinement
backlog.description: As a user, I want intuitive navigation so that I can easily find what I need
acceptance_criteria: Current user flows are documented
Usability issues are identified
Navigation is simplified where needed
Key actions require fewer taps

backlog.title: Visual Hierarchy Improvements
backlog.description: As a user, I want clear visual design so that I can easily understand the interface
acceptance_criteria: Font sizes are consistent and readable
Spacing follows design system
Colors provide clear hierarchy
Important actions are visually prominent

backlog.title: Local Push Notifications
backlog.description: As a patient, I want to receive notifications so that I don't miss appointments or tasks
acceptance_criteria: Notifications for upcoming appointments
Reminders for pending care tasks
Notifications are customizable
Do-not-disturb times respected

backlog.title: Accessibility Improvements
backlog.description: As a user with accessibility needs, I want the app to be usable so that I can access my healthcare information
acceptance_criteria: Screen reader support implemented
Sufficient color contrast ratios
Touch targets are appropriately sized
Text can be scaled without breaking layout

tasks.title: Audit and fix color contrast issues
Test and fix dynamic text scaling

backlog.title: Connect Frontend to Backend
backlog.description: As a developer, I want the React Native app to communicate with the Spring Boot backend so that data is persisted
acceptance_criteria: API service layer created in frontend
Authentication flow connected to backend
Appointments sync with backend
Care tasks sync with backend

tasks.title: Connect care task screens to API
Add error handling and loading states

backlog.title: Chat/Messaging API
backlog.description: As a patient, I want to communicate with hospital staff so that I can ask questions about my care
acceptance_criteria: Messages are stored and retrieved from backend
Real-time or near-real-time message delivery
Message history is preserved
Unread message indicators work correctly

sprints.name: Backend Foundation
sprints.goal: Complete backend setup and core API functionality

sprints.name: Data Persistence and Integration
sprints.goal: Set up PostgreSQL and connect frontend to backend

sprints.name: Advanced Scheduling
sprints.goal: Implement rescheduling, emergency handling, and patient-family linking

sprints.name: UI/UX and Notifications
sprints.goal: Improve user experience and implement notifications
